overview:
Attended Northeastern University for Computer Science and Cognitive Studies, and did work in artificial intelligence programming while obtaining significant work experience through their cooperative education program (interning at W.R. Grace and Goldman Sachs).

Shortly afterward, I became the head of technology at Garment Valet, a young Boston-based startup in need of automation and innovation. In three years, I successfully converted the company to a fully digital organization, streamlining operations and improving performance, including handling the administration of the department (personnel and budget).

From there, I transitioned into a full-time senior engineering position at Shape Up The Nation, a nationally recognized corporate social-network based in Providence, RI. Working on a LAMP architecture that is heavily trafficked in a fast-paced Agile environment, I developed many customer-facing applications with a strong focus on high availability and algorithmic relevancy, while leading projects and managing infrastructure advances.

I am now working at NameMedia as a senior software engineer and team leader. I am the principle engineer on the product NameFind and the redesign of Afternic. As well, I am actively developing a socially engineered citizen journalism service named Littera Report, built on a scalable LAMP architecture with strong localization emphasis. I am also the original developer and primary supporter of a PHP-based MVC framework named Helium.

milestones.description: Started web start-up in education management
